## Overview

**Slice Type:** Feature Enhancement
**Priority:** Medium
**Effort:** 6 hours
**Risk:** Low
**Dependencies:** VS-04 (operations)

Show the complete mathematical expression above the result display.

## User Story

```
As a user
I want to see my complete expression
So that I understand what I'm calculating
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Expression display shows complete calculation
- [ ] Updates in real-time as user inputs
- [ ] Shows proper mathematical notation
- [ ] Scrolls horizontally for long expressions
- [ ] Displays above main result
- [ ] Shows operation symbols correctly (×, ÷, etc.)

## Technical Requirements

**HTML Structure:**

```html
<div class="calculator__display">
  <div class="display__expression">5 + 3</div>
  <div class="display__value">8</div>
</div>
```

**Expression Building:**

```javascript
function buildExpression() {
  let expr = "";
  if (calculatorState.previousValue) {
    expr += calculatorState.previousValue;
  }
  if (calculatorState.operation) {
    const opSymbols = { "+": "+", "-": "−", "*": "×", "/": "÷" };
    expr += " " + opSymbols[calculatorState.operation] + " ";
  }
  if (calculatorState.currentValue && !calculatorState.awaitingOperand) {
    expr += calculatorState.currentValue;
  }
  return expr;
}
```

**CSS Requirements:**

- Smaller font size than main display
- Color differentiation from result
- Horizontal scroll for overflow
- Text alignment: right

## Implementation Checklist

- [ ] Create expression display element
- [ ] Implement expression building logic
- [ ] Update expression on state changes
- [ ] Add CSS styling
- [ ] Handle horizontal overflow
- [ ] Format operation symbols correctly
- [ ] Write unit tests
- [ ] Test with long expressions
- [ ] Test accessibility
